title: 820-2879 Issues
message: So a customer of mine gave me a couple of 820-2879 boards to mess with and the first one works but has no backlight, the second one though seems to have more problems. It wasn't turning on at first so i removed it from the chassis to inspect it and found no real signs of liquid damage, and to measure PP3V42_G3H resistance to GND. That was measuring 220K so I assumed the MCP is ok. Well after I put the board back in it started up to the Apple logo and progress bar. After about half way the logo and progress bar slowly faded out to a white screen. My two questions are: Did I just witness the GPU or MCP die? Other question is, how would I be able to tell by measurements?

title: 820-2879 Issues
message: So I figured out by mistake that the LCD connector on the board is messed up. When I push on it the logo fades and comes back and does other weird things. I touched up the joints and it seems better but when I put the bar down from the cable it causes it to ness up again. I may just replace the connector. The board does have a solid Apple logo and progress bar but the bar slowly move to the end and then freezes. At least I got the image disappearing thing figured out.

title: 820-2879 Issues
message: Did a PRAM Reset 3 times and that cleared up the slow booting issue. Now boots into OS login in like 3.5 seconds. So it looks like I just needed to talk myself through this one.

title: 820-2879 Issues
message: So which board needs assistance now?

title: 820-2879 Issues
message: Actually they are both solved and working. I do have an 820-2530 that I need to maybe create a thread on. PP3V42 and PPBUS were .08 and no Magsafe light. Found pad under pin 5 of U6690 was corroded away so I placed a temporary solder bridge to chip and trace, now have chime and backlight but no image.

title: 820-2879 Issues
message: Then open other thread, if needed...
